channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Standing water on road, 23rd November
item.description:
Every time there is rain the corner of Harcourt road floods. Cars travel at speed down this road despite 20mph, splashing pedestrians at best and risking aquaplaning at worst. This issue is on going and requires a permanent fix please

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 309A, Broadway, Blendon, Bexleyheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Regular flytip again, 23rd November
item.description:
Dumped grey baby cot and mattresses on pavement outside flats on bourdon road penge. regular dumping at this location
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourdon Road, Anerley, Greater London

item.title: Fly tipping, bodily waste products (sanitary towels, nappies), 23rd November
item.description:
This corner has become a regular spot for flytipping. Same people usually. There is CCTV on the restaurant Spinach that can help identify them. Incredible amount of waste at times.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 69-71, Westow Hill, Upper Norwood, Greater London

item.title: Speed humps not visible, 23rd November
item.description:
The markings on all the speed humps in Longton Grove have worn away so you can’t see them and it has damaged my car

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, Longton Grove, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gate welded open, 23rd November
item.description:
The gate the hawksley court has been welded open. This is meant to be a secure car park and residents’ insurances have been invalidated because of this. It also means the car park is always full and residents don’t have spaces for their own cars.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hawksley Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No connecting pathway, 23rd November
item.description:
I have fallen over here several times in wet conditions as there is no connecting pathway. This isn’t just about the leaves which are making even worse but because of the amount of mud the rain causes. I’d like to know why this is the only connection to the Thames path along the route that has been completely ignored. I need to use this pathway several times daily to walk my dog, and I am not the only person that is experiencing the problem of slipping over in the rain to become injured and covered in mud. There is a care home not 300 yards away that is forcing carers to push wheel chair users in the opposite direction because they are unable to access the Thames path due to flight of stairs at the end of the grassed area and this water logged connection to the Thames path. I have approached several people who all agree, this is my first message regarding this issue and depending on the outcome I am considering starting a petition to get it paved. I would rather not do this as it just takes time and effort. Please can we start arrangements now for this area to become safe for all users. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thamesbank Place, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
The pothole has been here for several months and nobody tooked action so far. Last time I drove at Epping Station during evening hours and the plthole was filled with water, I couldn't k ew that the pothole was there and I got with my car into it. The pothole was massive and deep.

item.title: Pavement repair is a trip hazzard and stopping water drainage, 23rd November
item.description:
Since the council took up the pavement due to the cherry tree roots, the tarmac replacing them is not flat and is a trip hazzard and also does not allow water to drain into the gutter as it used to for over 15 years. Please can this be fixed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Grangehill Road, Eltham

item.title: Leaf mulch build up, 23rd November
item.description:
This leaf mulch has not been cleared properly for at least 3 years . All the drains are blocked and the road floods . It is impossible to cross the road as you are ankle deep in wet mush . This is dangerously slippy .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Road, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain is blocked, 23rd November
item.description:

item.title: Fly tipping - multiple household items and getting worse, 23rd November
item.description:
Please can you clear the rubbish that has been dumped outside a disused garage between Barry and Henslowe Road on Upland road. This common fly tipping spot has had furniture and other items here since September. It is getting worse and worse with no action taken by the council. Please clear this rubbish.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upland Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
